alert.note: Alert for Central Columbia River Gorge (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 19 at 9:29AM PST until December 20 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches near river level, with 6 to 12 inches above 500 feet. * WHERE...Central Columbia River Gorge. * WHEN...Until noon PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There is also a chance of freezing rain for a brief period of time Sunday night and Monday morning from Cascade Locks eastward to Hood River, especially for elevations above 500 feet. If freezing rain does occur, expect light ice accumulations in addition to the aforementioned snow accumulations.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions visit https://www.tripcheck.com or https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map or by calling 5 1 1
